other_tests.findings: There is an inflamed blind-ending tubular structure in the right lower quadrant measuring approximately 11 mm in diameter with evidence of hyperdense material both at its origin and within it, consistent with appendicoliths. There is no evidence of free air. No drainable fluid collection is seen. The visualized lung bases are clear. The visualized heart is without pericardial effusion. The liver, gallbladder, bilateral adrenal glands, spleen, pancreas, and bilateral kidneys are normal. No bowel obstruction is seen. The aorta is normal in caliber and contour. There is no free fluid or free air throughout the abdomen. There is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy by CT size criteria. Aside from the aforementioned findings, the bladder, prostate, rectum, and sigmoid colon are normal. There is no free fluid or free air throughout the pelvis. There is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy. There are no lytic or sclerotic osseous lesions suspicious for malignancy.
